originalTitle: Bobi Wine tells the BBC from hiding he will not contest Uganda election results in court
title: Bobi Wine tells the BBC from hiding he will not contest Uganda election results in court
content: The losing presidential candidate calls for "peaceful change", saying Uganda's judiciary is not independent.

originalTitle: Anthony Joshua's driver appears in court after crash that killed two
title: Sad News: A Car Accident and What Happens Next
content:
Hello, my little news friends, from your reporter in Africa! Today, we have some important news about a very famous sports star named Anthony Joshua. He is a super strong boxer, known all over the world for his amazing punches and kind heart. He makes us proud!

Who is Anthony Joshua?

Anthony Joshua is a giant of a man, very tall and very strong. He is what we call a 'heavyweight champion' in boxing. This means he is one of the best boxers in the world! He has won many big fights and has a special belt to show how good he is. Many children look up to him as a hero. He works very hard to be strong and fast. When he fights, everyone cheers for him! He teaches us to never give up and to always try our best. He is a real inspiration for many young people, not just here in Africa but all around the globe.

A Sad Day and a Car Accident

Sometimes, even famous people go through sad times. We have some sad news to share. Anthony Joshua was in a car recently, and something very unfortunate happened. The car was in an accident. An accident is when something unplanned and bad happens, like a bump or a crash. This accident was very serious. Two people who were part of Anthony Joshua's team, meaning they worked with him and helped him, sadly lost their lives. This means they died. It is a very sad thing when someone passes away, especially in an accident. Anthony Joshua was also in the car when the accident happened. He was a passenger, which means he was riding in the car, but he was not the one driving. We are thankful that he was not badly hurt, but we know he must be very, very sad for his friends.

Did you know?

Did you know that Anthony Joshua has Nigerian roots? His parents are from Nigeria, and he often visits and shows his love for Africa! He is a proud African champion.

What Happens After an Accident?

When something very serious like a car accident happens, especially if people get hurt or sadly die, grown-ups need to find out exactly what happened. This is very important so we can learn from it and try to stop similar things from happening again. The person who was driving the car that day, Anthony Joshua's driver, has now gone to a special place called a court. A court is like a big, serious meeting place where people talk about rules and laws. It's where judges listen to what happened and decide what is fair.

What is a Court?

A court is a very important building. Inside, there are special people called judges and lawyers. They help to understand what happened when rules are broken or when sad things like accidents happen. They listen to all the stories and look at all the clues. Going to court does not always mean someone is bad. It means we are trying to find answers and make sure things are fair for everyone. The court will try to understand why the accident happened and if any rules were broken. It's all about trying to find 'justice', which means making things fair and right.

Why Road Safety is Important

This sad news reminds us all about how important it is to be safe on the road. Cars can be wonderful for taking us to school, to visit family, or on fun adventures. But they can also be dangerous if we are not careful.

Did you know?

Did you know that wearing a seatbelt in a car can save your life? It helps to keep you safe and still if the car suddenly stops or has a bump! Here are some simple rules for kids about road safety: * **Always wear your seatbelt!** Make sure it's snug across your chest and lap, and ask a grown-up to help you if it's too loose. * **Sit in the back seat!** It is the safest place for children. * **Never play near roads.** Roads are for cars, not for playing. * **Hold a grown-up's hand** when you are walking near a road or crossing it. * **Look both ways** – left, then right, then left again – before you cross the street. Make sure there are no cars coming. * **Wait for the green light** at traffic crossings before you walk.

Being Kind and Supportive

When sad things happen, like this accident, it is very important for us to be kind to each other. Anthony Joshua and the families of his team members must be feeling very sad right now. We can send them our good wishes and think of them. It's a time for everyone to remember the people who are no longer with us and to support those who are hurting. Being kind and showing love helps everyone feel a little better, even when times are tough.

What Happens Next?

The court will continue its work to understand everything about the accident. It will take some time, but they will make sure to find out what happened. We hope that this process brings some understanding and peace to everyone involved. Let's all remember to be safe, kind, and always look out for each other. Our hearts go out to Anthony Joshua and the families of his two team members. Stay safe, little news friends!
summary: Anthony Joshua's driver has gone to court after a sad car accident where two of his team members died, reminding us all about road safety.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows that even famous people go through sad times, and it teaches us how important it is to be safe on the roads and to be kind to each other when sad things happen.

title: Nigeria remembers master wood carver
content: Kasali Akangbe Ogun, who came from a long line of wood carvers and wanted to preserve local traditions, has been buried following his death after a brief illness.

content: More than 100 vehicles crashed into each other or slid off a highway during a snowstorm in the US state of Michigan.

title: Bournemouth sign midfielder Toth for £10.4m
content: Bournemouth sign Hungary international Alex Toth for £10.4m from Ferencvaros, with the midfielder joining the Cherries on a five-and-half-year contract.
